7
2SP Brewing Company UP, UP & AWAY New England Double IPA
Mosaic, Cascafe and Simcoe hops, wheat and oats. Big notes of peach, plum and citrus. 8% ABV (12 oz)
$
8
Love City Viaduct Unfiltered Pale Ale
An unfiltered pale ale from our friends and neighbors at Love City Brewing. A very drinkable ale made 100% Strata hops, with a soft
backdrop of malted oats. Dank, juicy berry-like hop flavor..
5.2% ABV
$
7.25
Downeast Cider House ORIGINAL BLEND UNFILTERED CRAFT CIDER
Juicy and sweet, tastes and smells like the farm-fresh cider you drank as a kid. Intensely flavorful, remarkably drinkable. This is a hard cider and contains 5.1% alcohol.

6.50

Beverage
Happy Hour
London’s culinary revolution makes landfall stateside care of The Dandelion, a sophisticated homage to the British pub serving updated seasonal takes on U.K. cuisine.
Just steps from Philadelphia’s bustling Rittenhouse Square, this inviting bilevel restaurant features a whirlwind of idiosyncratic seating areas, bars, hallways, rooms and nooks, each impeccably fashioned to carry its own personality. Whether you’re relaxing with a rare cask ale by the brick fireplace, taking afternoon tea in the Victorian-style dining room or enjoying our famous burger in the ruff-and-tumble “Dog Room,” there’s space for everyone. The menu, featuring beloved classics like Welsh rarebit, fish and chips, shepherd’s pie and a U.K. cheese board, also features plenty of unexpected surprises. Made-from-scratch puddings and hearty family-style roasts served every Sunday round out one of Philly’s most tantalizing dining destinations.
Group Dining
FEATURES
• Available for Lunch, Brunch, Afternoon Tea and Dinner
• Cask Beer & Craft Cocktails
• Seating for up to 25 guests in the Main Dining Room.
• Seating for up to 22 guests in Private Dining Room, Inglenook
• Seating for up to 25 guests or 35 standing in Private Dining Room, Dog Bar
• Seating for up to 45 guests in Private Dining Room, Big Room
• Seating for up to 70 guests in combined Private Dining Rooms, Big Room and Dog Bar

$12.50

$10

Taproom
Sip at the Source.
Yards has been brewing in the City of Brotherly Love since 1994. We've brewed in Manayunk, Roxborough, Kensington and Northern Liberties, always making what we like to drink and sharing the rest with our friends, family and neighbors. That tradition lives on at our new brewery and taproom at 500 Spring Garden Street.
Happy Hour: 3-6pm Mon-Fri
Drinks
$6 - Select 20oz Beers
$9 - All Cocktails & Wine
Snacks
$6 - Hummus Plate, IPA Pretzel, Bricklayer's Nachos, Everything Bagel Deviled Eggs
$12 - Philly Wing Pounders
Menus
Drink Menu
See What's On Tap
View Menu
Food Menu
Available All Day, Every Day
View Menu
Reservations
Get ready to savor Philly's finest craft brews and mouthwatering bites. Book your table ahead of time and skip the line! Plenty of large communal seating means we're great for large groups! If you don't see a reservations available, please feel free to come in. We save a handful of tables for walk-ins.
Book Now
Community Table
The Community Table is a semi-private reservation with a food and beverge package in the taproom. For groups of 10-50 guests, it is perfect for happy hours, birthday parties, alumni gatherings, and more.
Learn More
Tours
The Yards brewery tour gives thirsty guests a behind-the-scenes look at how Philly’s Beer is made. You and your friends will learn about the brewing process and hear the Story of Yards, with plenty of comedy along the way.
Learn More
Visit Yards
We hope to see you soon!
Taproom Info
Address
500 Spring Garden St.
Philadelphia, PA 19123
Call the Taproom
(215) 525-0175
Store Hours
Mon-Wed: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm
Thurs-Fri: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm
Sat: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm
Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm
Parking is accessible on 5th Street in the lot behind the brewery as well as surrounding street parking, but for many reasons (legal and environmental), we encourage you to consider public transportation, especially if you plan on imbibing our fine products. SEPTA's Market Frankford Line stops a few blocks away at 2nd and Spring Garden Street.
Get directions
Yards Brewing Co.
We don't believe things are made in Philadelphia. We believe things are made BY Philadelphia.

Make Your Own Kid-Wich
A little something simple for the kids. pick your own protein (turkey or salami), your condiments (mustard, mayo, or dry), and your toppings (swiss, american, pickles, lettuce). Comes on potato bread or rye depending on the day. Served cold. That’s it.

A Neighborhood Staple
Sabrina’s Cafe & Spencer’s Too has been serving the best brunch Philadelphia has to offer since 2007, right in the heart of the vibrant Callowhill/Art Museum district. Nestled within walking distance of iconic landmarks like the Philadelphia Museum of Art and the Barnes Foundation, our cozy, BYOB eatery blends eclectic charm with a warm, inviting atmosphere. Whether you're a local or a visitor, we’re a must-stop destination for breakfast, lunch and brunch in Philly, where generous portions, creative dishes, and a laid-back vibe make every meal memorable.
Our unique setup includes a street-side eatery and weekend parking lot seating, adding to the relaxed ambiance. Inside, the decor—a nostalgic nod to the 2000s—features artistic furnishings that make our space feel like home. From indulgent stuffed French toast to savory breakfast burritos, we’re proud to be a go-to spot for Philadelphia breakfast and brunch lovers looking for bold flavors and hearty portions.
More than just a restaurant, Sabrina’s Cafe & Spencer’s Too is an integral part of the Callowhill community. Regulars and newcomers alike gather here to share meals, stories, and laughter  Philadelphia foodies rave about. Whether you're fueling up before a day of exploring or simply indulging in a weekend tradition, we’re here to make every meal experience unforgettable.
We invite you to stop by and dig into a truly one-of-a-kind Philadelphia brunch experience—right here at Sabrina’s Cafe & Spencer’s Too.

Sofi Corner is a unique gourmet cafe-restaurant in Philadelphia. Driven by the passion of Soufiane and Christophe, we offer fresh-baked croissants and baguettes daily, an all-day brunch available every day of the week, and classic French brasserie dishes like quiche, Croque Madame, and Niçoise salad, perfect to enjoy on the go or to take away. Start your morning with our wide selection of Italian coffee, great for a quick breakfast before heading to work. Savor a cozy brunch or treat yourself to our refined dinner service, available exclusively on weekends. We also offer catering for any occasion, whether at work, home, or a special event venue. Sofi Corner has something for every moment, from fast breakfasts to gourmet weekend dining.

IT’S A GOOD DAY TO BE SWAYED
about the wayward
The Wayward is inspired by the rebellious spirit of Stephen Girard and his journey from Bordeaux to Philly. We are a place where weary travelers and curious locals alike can come together over good food and easy conversation. So wander over and stay for a bit. We’ll be waiting with a strong drink in hand.
menu
Our menu is focused on American classic and our food, drinks and extensive gin selections are some of the best in the city. Please note, the menu is subject to change and is frequently updated to reflect the seasonality of ingredients.

A Neighborhood Staple
University City is a vibrant hub of innovation and education, home to esteemed institutions like Drexel University and the University of Pennsylvania. For those looking some of the best brunch Philadelphia has to offer, Sabrina’s Cafe at Ross Commons is a must-visit. Since opening in 2011, this beloved spot has been a go-to for Philadelphia brunch lovers, serving up generous portions in a cozy, sunlit space that includes an outdoor patio and indoor porch seating. Sabrina’s offers the perfect spot to fuel up before exploring nearby landmarks like the Penn Museum, the Institute of Contemporary Art, and Cira Green. From campus tours and graduations to white coat ceremonies and casual meals with friends, Sabrina’s is a place where memories are made over plates of delicious, comforting food. If you're searching for brunch near me or breakfast near me in University City, look no further. Come experience why we’re a staple of this dynamic neighborhood, blending history, community, and mouthwatering meals to create a brunch Philadelphia locals keep coming back for!

name: Molly Malloy's
raw_text:
Home - Molly Malloys
Open Menu
About
Menu
Gift Cards
Events
Mailing List
Hi there, thanks for visiting! Here’s the quick version: we serve great food, sourced from around the Reading Terminal Market with an expansive tap featuring over 30 beers. Oh, and we have seats. If you have never been to the Market this might not seem like a big deal… it kind of is. Dine-in or to-go, you can expect the best. Stop by and say hi!
learn more
Experience the best Reading Terminal Market has to offer all in one menu.
TO-GO
As much as we’d love for you to stay, kick back, and relax, we understand you’ve got important stuff to do. Luckily, our whole menu is available to-go for a satisfying and delicious meal wherever you go. Order online or at the counter for ultimate convenience. And did we mention our beer and wine are also available to-go? Yep, that’s right. Feel free to order a beer at our bar and we’ll give you a cup that can be taken around the Market or choose a growler that can be enjoyed at home.
Give us a call at
(267)-525-1001
, or order online!  Pick-up orders for breakfast, lunch, beer, and wine can be placed through Toast, and food delivery is available with Caviar and DoorDash.
TOAST PICK-UP ORDERS
CAVIAR DELIVERY
DOORDASH DELIVERY

Philadelphia’s Valley Green Inn
Gift Cards
Reservations
– a historic tavern on the Wissahickon
Great First Dates In Philadelphia
When it’s all about the initial impression.
Making New Culinary History
As you ease your car right onto gravelly, serpentine Valley Green Road, skirting the gurgling creek under a thickening canopy of leaves, you begin to feel the difference. You cross the concrete bridge spanning the Wissahickon and turn left into an idyll that tickles your heart.
The Valley Green Inn hosts many, many events
Some of the events in the past year have included weddings, baby showers, sweet sixteen parties, bon voyage parties, business retreats, rehearsal dinners, holiday parties, birthday parties, and many more.
Make A Reservation
Please note that the availability listed on partyspace.com may be for the patio area only. If you have any special requests besides those listed, please call us and we’ll be glad to put together an event tailored just for you! Contact Amber Atkinson at 215.247.1730 ext 109, or email
Amber
.
History
It is rumored that the Valley Green Inn was established in 1683.
Well, almost… The Valley Green Inn is built on land that was part of a several hundred acre tract purchased from William Penn in 1685. It had absentee owners in England and Ireland until 1791 when it was bought by the Livezey family who ran a large grist mill downstream.
In about the year 1850, Thomas Livezey rented to Edward Rinker about three acres of land on the Wissahickon Creek below and adjoining the stone arch bridge. He was to build a house and had the privilege of having boats on the stream to accommodate picnics. He paid two years rent January 2, 1852 of $50.
Rinker may have first built a smaller dwelling and then soon after built a larger building he named the Valley Green Hotel. There followed a succession of innkeepers throughout the nineteenth century, all who no doubt served catfish, waffles, and chicken dinners; the popular fare of other Wissahickon establishments.
The Valley Green Hotel was built during 1850-51 at the same time as the Wissahickon Turnpike (Lincoln Drive) was being completed. The turnpike brought recreational visitors into the Valley by carriage and horseback to view the lovely scenery.
In 1868, the newly created Fairmount Park Commission appropriated the creek and its banks, including the turnpike, and they improved the condition of the road and removed the toll gates. The Livezeys then sold the hotel to the Park in 1873.
In 1899, the chief engineer of Fairmount Park recommended the building be demolished; it was in disrepair and the Park did not have the funds to renovate. Fortunately the building was saved by a local committee, headed by Charles W. Henry, which raised $1228 for the restoration.
In 1901, a committee of women, arranged by Lydia T. Morris, was given permission by the Park to manage the newly restored Valley Green Hotel. They served light refreshments and afternoon tea to riders, pedestrians and wintertime skaters. These women managed the popular Valley Green Hotel in this manner for many years. At this time, the restaurant became officially known as the Valley Green Inn.
In the mid-1930’s, the Friends of the Wissahickon, a large group dedicated to the preservation of the Valley, became interested in the Inn. Restorations were again necessary, and, under the leadership of the Friends and Park Commissioner, Samuel Fleisher, new foundations, a new roof and timbers were added. The Inn was re-dedicated at a ceremonial dinner in 1937. The Inn has been under the joint care of the friends of the Wissahickon and the Park Commission ever since yet remains a privately run business.
Throughout the years, the Inn has been the focus of numerous paintings, postcards and writings, as well as the setting for many special occasions. T.A. Daily wrote in 1922 that, “The charm of Valley Green varies not only with the seasons, but with the day of the week and the hour of the day.”
Directions
From South Jersey via Walt Whitman bridge
76 West across the Walt Whitman to Lincoln Drive, follow directions from Main Line.
From South Jersey via Betsy Ross bridge
676 West (Vine Street Expressway) to 76 West. (the Schuylkill) 76 West to Lincoln Drive, follow directions from Main Line.
From Points South including Delaware, Baltimore, Washington D.C.
95 North to 76 West. Take exit 340A and follow signs for Lincoln Drive. After the ramp to Lincoln Drive, go 3 miles and make a left on McCallum St. Follow McCallum until it dead ends on Wolcott St. Make a left on Wolcott, follow it until it dead ends into Valley Green Road. Make a left on Valley Green road. The road will end in a parking lot that is about 30 yards from the Inn. Additional parking lots are located on Forbidden drive (via Wises Mill road) and on Valley Green road. Please note that during peak season and private events, the parking lot closest to the inn may be restricted to patrons only.
From PA Turnpike
Exit at Ft. Washington (Exit 338). Take 309 south to Paper Mill Road. Make a right on Paper Mill road. Follow approximately three miles until you reach Stenton Avenue (4th light). Make a hard left on Stenton (You’ll see sign for Stenton after you make hard left). Follow another 1 mile to Willow Grove Avenue. Make a right on Willow Grove. Drive to Germantown Avenue, make a left, follow two blocks, make a right on Springfield Avenue. Follow straight until road forks, bear right. The road will end in a parking lot that is about 30 yards from the Inn. Additional parking lots are located on Forbidden drive (via Wises Mill road) and on Valley Green road. Please note that during peak season and private events, the parking lot closest to the inn may be restricted to patrons only.
From New York, Central & North Jersey via NJ Turnpike
NJ Turnpike south to Pennsylvania turnpike. (Exit 6 on the NJ Turnpike) Follow directions from PA Turnpike.
From Roosevelt Blvd (Northeast Philadelphia)
Take Roosevelt Blvd. until you reach the Henry Avenue/Fox Avenue exit. Right on Fox. Left on Queen Lane. Right on Henry Avenue. Go North on Henry Avenue, follow approximately 4 miles until you reach Wise’s Mill Rd. Turn right on Wise’s Mill Road. This will take you down to Forbidden Drive. (you can only travel one way) Follow Forbidden drive until you reach parking lot. (1/4 mile) The Valley Green is 100 yards from this parking lot.
From the Main Line
Take City Line Avenue to Lincoln Drive. Take Lincoln Drive to McCallum St. (1.2 miles past the first light). Make a left at McCallum Street. Follow McCallum until it dead ends on Wolcott St. Make a left on Wolcott, follow it until it dead ends into Valley Green Road. Make a left on Valley Green road. The road will end in a parking lot that is about 30 yards from the Inn. Additional parking lots are located on Forbidden drive (via Wises Mill road) and on Valley Green road. Please note that during peak season and private events, the parking lot closest to the inn may be restricted to patrons only.
As always, if you need more directions (or may have made a wrong turn), feel free to call us at 215.247.1730.

Our Story
On Rittenhouse Square
Philly's spot for creative cocktails and late-night escapades, the Franklin Mortgage & Investment Company hides behind an unmarked door–a subtle nod to a bootlegging backstory that dates back to the Prohibition era. A mix of low lighting, and down-right-delicious cocktails, The Franklin continuously pushes the boundaries of drink innovations—delivering generous pours and unforgettable evenings.
Our Story
Hours Of Operation
Sunday - Thursday
5 pm - 12 am
Friday - Saturday
5 pm - 2 am
Go Ahead, Have a Sip
The imaginatively crafted cocktails you love are back and, dare we say, better than ever. Edgy, occasionally experiential, always next-level. These are the drinks that made The Franklin Mortgage & Investment Co. Philly's spot for spirited innovations.
See Menus
Private Events
Unforgettable Gatherings
For intimate gatherings that leave a lasting impression, our moody 1920s-inspired bar is at your service. Perfect for connecting with others—from hosting unique corporate events and social gatherings to reminiscing with friends. It’s all here, beyond the red door.
Private Events

OREGON DINER
SINCE THE
60’S
BEING PART OF
PHILLY’S STORY
!
Here in South Philly, we do two things better than anybody: good food and good stories. For generations, Oregon Diner has been serving up both. Enjoy our delicious all-day breakfast, treat yourself to our affordable everyday entrée specials, or perk up with a midnight coffee and cookie.
Our Chef is always cooking up something fresh, and our bakery serves up homemade breads and pastries six days a week. Our extensive menu and full bar have something for every taste 7 days a week.
Whether you’re starting a new adventure, capping off a wild night out, or trading tall tales with new friends, come and see us. On cold, dark nights and hot summer days, we’ll be here, serving up the best food in South Philly. Come on in and make the Oregon Diner part of your Philadelphia story.
STAY IN TOUCH

Our Food Menu
Classic American food with some brilliant modern twists
, and a lot from scratch.
We are open for lunch, dinner, and brunch on the weekend. You’ve never seen “bar food” done like this.
During brunch, we offer a limited regular menu. We also offer items for those sensitive to gluten.

Fearless Gift Cards may be used at any Fearless Restaurant. Order Gift Cards online to be mailed for an additional cost or in person at any restaurant. Digital Gift Cards are also available right from your computer or smartphone to order and send by email or text.
Click here
GIVE ONE TODAY!
White Dog Cafe brought its unusual blend of award-winning contemporary American cuisine, civic engagement & environmental sustainability to the Main Line in 2010. Known for warm hospitality and inspiring and award-winning food, surrounded by charming and whimsical dog décor and artwork. White Dog Cafe Wayne has four distinctive dining areas with their own unique charm and personality, in addition to the outdoor patio.  The Den and Bar has a mahogany coffered ceiling, needlepoint dog pillows, and a striking wall of oil paintings of your favorite dogs. The Garden Room has chicken-wired ceilings with floral prints, antique lighting fixtures, and wooden shutters from North Carolina
. The
Library's mahogany ceiling has whimsical flying books. The Kitchen has reclaimed floors and ceilings with copper pans lining the wall.
With a passion for creating inspiring, flavorful dishes, Chef Greg Maloney's menus change seasonally to ensure we use the freshest local and seasonal ingredients.
TAKE A TOUR
Open for indoor dining and outdoor dining on the patio, weather permitting, with takeout and delivery.

name: Suraya
raw_text:
Yalla! Welcome To Suraya | Market, Restaurant & Garden in Fishtown, Philadelphia
Order Online
Menus
Reservations
About
Rewards
Gift Cards
Events
Contact
Order Online
Menus
Reservations
About
Rewards
Gift Cards
Events
Contact
Scroll
Suraya is an award-winning specialty market, restaurant and garden located in the bustling Fishtown neighborhood of Philadelphia.
Lunch
Wednesday - Friday: 11AM-2PM
Brunch
Saturday & Sunday: 10AM-2PM
(Market opens at 9AM)
Dinner
Sunday - Thursday: 5PM-10PM
Friday & Saturday: 5PM-11PM
Order Online
Make A Reservation
The Market
A modern-day bazaar celebrating the variety of life, our café offers various man'oushe options, salads, sandwiches, house-made French and Levantine pastries, Reanimator coffee, cocktails and more. Visit our marketplace for grab-and-go items, as well as a mix of local and imported pantry items like spices and olive oil. Cookbooks, dishes, and housewares are also for sale and great gift ideas for the habibi in your life.
The Restaurant
Get ready to enjoy a full lunch, brunch, dinner and bar service every day and night here at Suraya! Serving classical and modern, Levant-inspired dishes, our menu is bound to satiate any craving. Don't forget to try a glass of
Arak
or one of our many cocktails - all of which have been named after the beautiful words of Lebanese poet Khalil Gibran!
The Garden
Imagine a beautiful outdoor oasis and lounge with a fire pit to keep you warm, cocktails and wines pouring from the bar and the beautiful voices of classical Arab artists such as
Farid El Atrash
and
Fairuz
playing in the background. We know you'll fall in love with the atmosphere, and won't be surprised if you end up staying all night enjoying our beautiful outdoor garden space.
Our Menus
With flavors to take you around the world, our menu consists of ancient Levantine ingredients, flowery essences and heritage recipes from our beautiful grandmother, Suraya.
Brunch Menu
Lunch Menu
Dinner Menu
Dessert Menu
“This space is in honor of our grandmother's strength and bravery that kept our family together in Lebanon. We hope that her genuine passion for food and family is shown throughout all the details.”
- Nathalie Richan
Reservations
Reservations are available seven days a week through Resy.com!
Book your Suraya reservation on Resy
Treat Your Loved Ones
Give the gift of Suraya by purchasing a gift card below!
Buy
Contact
For questions or comments, visit us at Suraya, or email us at
Hello@SurayaPhilly.com
.
We are always looking for passionate, talented and hospitable staff to join our team here at Suraya. For career inquiries, please send your resume to
Managers@SurayaPhilly.com
to be considered for future positions and openings.
Shukran!
For event inquiries, please follow the link below.

name: Marrakesh Restaurant
raw_text:
Marrakesh MENU (update September 2025)
Skip to content
Marrakesh
Home
About
Menu
Reservations
Photos
Marrakesh Menu
The menu updated on January 26, 2020. If you would like to know more about upcoming changes, please contact the restaurant hotline
+1 215-925-5929.
Indulge in Authentic Flavors
At Marrakesh, one can embark on a culinary journey that explores the rich tapestry of authentic Moroccan flavors. The commitment to delivering an unparalleled dining experience begins with the essence of Moroccan cuisine. Each dish at Marrakesh is a carefully crafted masterpiece, meticulously prepared to capture the true essence of Moroccan gastronomy.
When guests indulge in the authentic flavors, the custoner will discover a symphony of spices and ingredients that have been passed down through generations. From the aromatic spices like cumin, coriander, and saffron to the freshest herbs and succulent meats, the kitchen at Marrakesh is a treasure trove of premium ingredients sourced with precision and care. Whether savoring the tender lamb with chickpeas and onions or delighting in the layered chicken pie, the authenticity is evident in every bite.
Premium Ingredient Sourcing
The dedication to quality starts with a commitment to sourcing the finest ingredients. No stone is left unturned in the quest to procure premium, locally-sourced ingredients that meet exacting standards. The chefs collaborate with trusted suppliers who share the passion for excellence, ensuring that every element of the meal is of the highest quality.
From the freshest vegetables and herbs to the choicest cuts of meat, the ingredient sourcing process is a testament to the commitment to authenticity and flavor. When diners choose Marrakesh, the customer can trust that the meal has been prepared with the utmost care and the finest ingredients available.
Let’s Try Marrakesh Menu
Marrakesh is not just a restaurant; it’s a gateway to the authentic flavors of Morocco. With a dedication to premium ingredient sourcing and a specially crafted menu, guests are invited to indulge in the rich and tantalizing world of Moroccan cuisine, right here in the heart of Philadelphia. The culinary adventure awaits at Marrakesh, where authenticity and flavor are at the forefront of every dish.

***THERE IS A 3% FEE FOR CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS***
Our Prix Fixe Menu
Frequently Asked Questions
Please reach us at
casablancamg947@gmail.com
if you cannot find an answer to your question.
Does casablancagrill.com take reservations?
Yes, we strongly recommend making a reservation to ensure a table is available when you arrive; However, We recommend calling us to make a reservation instead of emailing through the website as the tables fill quickly.
Is there a special menu on weekends?
Monday through Thursday from open to close and Friday and Saturday from open until 4pm customers who dine in have a choice between the Pre-fix menu or A la Carte menu; however, Fridays and Saturdays from 4pm until close we only serve the pre-fix menu for dine in.
Does casablancagrill.com have outdoor seating?
Yes, when the weather is nice we put tables outside.

About the Business
Fattoush is a new restaurant that has opened on Lancaster avenue in Malvern in the location previously occupied by the King Street Grill and right near Margaret Kuo's. It's run by Roger of Roger's Bistro in West Chester who consistently earns 5 star tripadvisor reviews for not only the incredible quality of his cooking but also for his warmth and hospitality!

Right now the restaurant is open for dinner in a soft opening as Roger "tweaks" the menu. Presently there are many classic Mediterranean dishes including hummus, falafel, baba ganoush, kibbe, lamb and chicken.

The restaurant space is light and airy will a nice palette of colors on the walls, ceilings and floors. During this soft opening they are continuing to refine and adjust the ambiance with music, additional wall coverings and other esthetic touches. If you want to get your mediterranean/middle eastern food fix right now, don't hesitate to dine at Fattoush.

Dining at Fattoush is like eating a delicious home cooked meal prepared by a close relative who happens to live in another country and have expertise with that cuisine!
…
Read more
Ask the Community
Ask a question
Q:
Is the meat halal? thanks
A:
Yes, the meat is halal. We asked the owner. Some restaurants do not advertise if they are halal because it's off putting to some people. Sad reality of the climate we live in. That's why you should always call to ask and not assume.
Christina T.

Our Menu
Our menu features wholesome, delicious Middle Eastern flavors, and high quality ingredients. Build your own meal and don't be shy about adding toppings - they're unlimited!

View PDF

Our Menu
STEP 1:
PICK YOUR BASE
Vermicelli Rice
A mix of white rice with golden-brown vermicelli.
dairy, wheat, vegetarian
Tri-Color Quinoa
Tri-Color Quinoa
Fluffy and earthy white, red, and black grains. A protein-packed and gluten-free base.
vegetarian, vegan
Romaine Lettuce
Crisp and refreshing - a crunchy foundation for our salads.
vegetarian, vegan
Seasonal Greens
A tasty mix of baby spinach, arugula and red cabbage.
vegetarian, vegan
White Pita
Soft, light and freshly baked.
wheat, vegetarian, vegan
Whole Wheat Pita
A fiber-rich option for health-conscious diners.
wheat, vegetarian, vegan
STEP 2:
CHOOSE YOUR PROTEIN
Chicken Shawarma
Juicy and flavorful roasted chicken marinated in middle eastern spices.
dairy, halal
Beef Shawarma
Tender strips of beef marinated in authentic spices.
dairy
Kafta Lamb Kebab
A combination of ground beef and lamb with fresh herbs and spices.
Chicken Kebab
Flavor packed grilled chicken breast.
dairy
Falafel
Crispy golden vegan chickpea croquettes seasoned with a special blend of herbs and spices.
vegetarian, vegan
Cauliflower
Marinated cauliflower florets seasoned with herbs and spices. A tasty vegan choice.
vegetarian, vegan
STEP 3:
ADD UNLIMITED TOPPINGS
Hummus
Smooth and creamy blended chickpeas, tahini, and a hint of lemon.
sesame, vegetarian, vegan
Baba Ghannouj
Smokey roasted eggplant dip blended with tahini, lemon and labne.
dairy, sesame, vegetarian
Cucumber Yogurt
Cucumber yogurt topping infused with mint and garlic.
dairy, vegetarian
Romaine Lettuce
Fresh and crisp chopped lettuce.
vegetarian, vegan
Tomatoes
Cubed tomatoes.
vegetarian, vegan
Cucumbers
Diced cucumbers.
vegetarian, vegan
Jalapeños
Sliced peppers.
spicy, vegetarian, vegan
Sumac Onions
A blend of red onions, parsley and tangy sumac.
vegetarian, vegan
Feta Cheese
Crumbled feta cheese.
dairy, vegetarian
Cabbage Slaw
Peppery cabbage mix with dry mint, lemon and olive oil.
vegetarian, vegan
Lebanese Pickles
Lebanese pickles brined in a traditional mix of vinegar and spices.
vegetarian, vegan
Pickled Turnips
Turnips fermented in vinegar for a sharp, tangy flavor.
vegetarian, vegan
Kalamata Olives
Rich, salty, and fresh. Imported directly from Kalamata, Greece.
vegetarian, vegan
Toum (Garlic Whip)
Creamy and bold garlic spread.
vegetarian, vegan
Zesty Jalapeño Sauce
A hot blend of jalapeños, herbs and spices.
spicy, vegetarian, vegan
Spicy Red Pepper Sauce
A smoky, spicy blend with cayenne pepper, allspice, cinnamon, paprika, and other spices.
mild, vegetarian, vegan
Lemon Tahini
Bright, nutty, creamy, and tangy sauce made with sesame seeds and fresh lemon juice.
sesame, vegetarian, vegan
Pomegranate Dressing
Our pomegranate vinaigrette is sweet and tangy - a vibrant and fruity addition to your salad.
dairy free, gluten free, nuts free, vegetarian, vegan
SALADS & COLD APPETIZERS
Little Tabboule
A mix of parsley, mint, bulgur and tomatoes, dressed with lemon and olive oil.
wheat, vegetarian, vegan
Hummus
Smooth and creamy blended chickpeas, tahini, and a hint of lemon.
sesame, vegetarian, vegan
Spicy Hummus
A hot twist on our classic hummus, featuring jalapeño, lemon, and parsley.
mild, sesame, vegetarian, vegan
Baba Ghannouj
Smokey roasted eggplant dip blended with tahini, lemon and labne.
dairy, sesame, vegetarian
Grape Leaves
Grape leaves stuffed with a savory mixture of rice, onions, dill, mint and black pepper.
vegetarian, vegan
Labne
A soft cheese made from strained yogurt. Spread on a pita or enjoy it as a dip.
dairy, vegetarian
Cucumber Yogurt
Cucumber yogurt dip infused with mint and garlic.
dairy, vegetarian
Cabbage Slaw
Peppery cabbage mix with dry mint, lemon and olive oil.
vegetarian, vegan
HOT APPETIZERS
Kibbe
Crispy beef dumplings filled with minced beef and pine nuts.
dairy, tree nut, wheat
Fatayer
Vegetable mini-pie filled with spinach, lemon and sumac.
wheat, vegetarian, vegan
Rekakat
Blend of 3 Mediterranean cheeses wrapped in phyllo and deep fried to golden perfection.
dairy, wheat, vegetarian
Falafel
Crispy golden vegan chickpea croquettes seasoned with a special blend of herbs and spices.
vegetarian, vegan
SWEETS
Pistachio Baklava
A crispy sweet pastry made of layers of phyllo filled with pistachio and hints of lemon, rose water, and orange blossom.
tree nut, wheat, vegan
Cashew Baklava
Crispy, rolled phyllo fingers filled with cashews and hints of lemon, rose water, and orange blossom.
tree nut, wheat, vegan
Namoura Coconut Cake
A classic Middle Eastern dessert made with farina, soaked in a fragrant rose water and orange blossom syrup. Moist, sweet, and delicately flavored with hints of almond and coconut.
dairy, tree nut, wheat
PANTRY
Pomegranate Molasses
Infuse your marinades and salads with a burst of sweet, tangy richness. Drizzle over NAYA's seasonal greens or even your favorite ice cream for a bold, new twist.
vegan
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
From Koura, Lebanon, our unfiltered, unrefined extra virgin olive oil offers natural richness with a peppery finish. Ideal for drizzling over NAYA hummus, baba ghannouj or labne.
vegan
Za’atar
A Lebanese classic. Thyme, sumac, and toasted sesame seeds bring an aromatic touch to dips, marinades or rubs. Try a dash over NAYA’s labne, or combined with olive oil for dipping pita bread.
sesame, tree nut
Spicy Red Pepper Seasoning
This vibrant blend of red pepper, paprika, cumin, coriander and basil brings Lebanese flavors to any dish. Add a zesty kick to your roasted potatoes, kabobs or sprinkle it over NAYA hummus.
vegan
Mixed Nuts
Snack time just got better with our mixed nuts. Enjoy a savory mix of Lebanese-style peanuts, salted almonds, cashews, chickpeas, corn, hazelnuts, pumpkin seeds and more.
tree nut, wheat

Looking to apply for a career at Estia?

Visiting & Dress Code
Here at Estia we ask all of our guest to dress their best!  As we aim to create a comfortable and inclusive environment for all, Estia does not permit sleeveless tee-shirts, cut-off shorts, or exposed undergarments. This policy is in place to maintain a respectful and professional atmosphere within our organization. We appreciate your cooperation in adhering to these guidelines.
* Estia reserves the right to turn away anyone not dressed properly to dine at our restaurants. Thank you!
Estia Taverna Menus
Experience the true flavors of the Greek Mediterranean right here in Marlton, NJ. We serve fresh, flavorful dishes crafted to satisfy any craving. Complement your meal with a selection from our exceptional wine list or specialty cocktail menu. Join us and let your culinary journey across the sea begin!

Reservations

Reserve
Reviews
Google reviews
Rory G:
The food is always freshly made and flavorful. Their Gyros are awesome and fresh with authentic Greek flavors. Today I tried the #2 Combination platter which features a meat kabob, sliced lamb and beef combo as would be in a Gyro, rice and Turlu which is a Greek veggie combination and delicious.
Google reviews
Darshan S:
Best Greek restaurant in Philly! The food is awesome, you can taste the freshness or the ingredients - no wonder this place has been around for almost 5 decades. The staff is very friendly and the service is amazing to top off the delicious food and the wide spread.
Google reviews
Suzy A:
This is the best Greek restaurant EVER! I am from NYC and I was impressed with the places in Astoria until I came here. Decor is authentic, great atmosphere, excellent service. All the dishes I have tried on the menu are perfection. I want to try everything. So far, I have had the grilled pork chop and braised lamb. Both so amazing.
Google reviews
Tommy D:
Authentic Greek food, grilled right in front of you.. The place is great and it's been a staple on South Street for as long as I have been alive. Chicken Souvlaki  w/ everything is the play.. get 2.. you won't be disappointed
Google reviews
Ryan L:
Had a great lunch here today, getting the grilled chicken breast salad.  The amount of chicken was plentiful, and the flavor is incredible!  The feta and chick peas was also nice.  I'd definitely come back here to try some of their other meats on the spit.  Thank you!

Specialties & More

Greek Fries

Add Item
Wings
We serve fresh jumbo wings! Served with your choice of flavors.  Pick between Hot, Mild, BBQ or Dry.
Add Item
Souvlakia
Our gyro and skewers are made in house with the finest cuts of meats & no preservatives.
Add Item
Rice Bowls
Rice pilaf served with grilled red peppers & asparagus
Add Item
About Us
We're so excited to bring the fresh flavors of Greece to our neighbors. We hope that you'll visit us for a casual lunch or a special dinner soon.
Learn More
Our Food
We serve the freshest ingredients to bring you the authentic flavor of Greece.
Full Menu
Catering
Let us cater your next event!
Order Now
The Latest News!
Read More
Customer Reviews
Check out our most recent reviews!
Justin Staudenmayer
Delicious food! Ordered the baklava and a pita sandwich. Got it for take-out, and it was fresh as could be upon delivery
Tifani Kirchem
Atmosphere and customer service was great.
Greek and Lamb Gyros were delicious (we ordered the fries on the side rather than in it). A different kind of tatziki than I've had, it had a little spice to it, but it was delicious. The pita was perfectly crisped on the outside. The gyros were loaded with meat was so much I
...
had to take some off to be able to bite it, but they were delicious. Surprisingly, the fries were tasty too. Not just a plain french fry.

The baklava was pretty good. Not too sweet and perfectly cooked.
Read More
Janine Bergey
Enjoyed a mid afternoon meal here and everything was great, from friendly service to quality food and comfortable (AC on a warm day!) ambiance.
Having recently been to Greece, ð¬ð· I can attest to this food being spot on authentic! We got the gyros (chicken and lamb) as well as a personal fave - Dolmadas! Mmmmâ¦ thank
...
you Eat Greek! Will come again!
Read More
Danii Urrutia
The food was amazing! Itâs delicious, the best Greek food I have ever had, the host is very friendly and the place is so nice, all the decoration will make you to feel like you are in Greece.
Kingston Ko
Great addition to Conshohocken with something other than pizza and cheese steaks! We tried a couple of gyros and the baklava. Fries inside a gyro was something new to me but I didnt mind it. The food was tasty and filling and the shop itself is bright and inviting. There is a small dining area in the back that looks
...
great too. I'll be back to try a few more menu items for sure.
Read More
Jonathan Weiss
Iâm not from the area but was staying nearby for an event and decided to give this place a try. Was greeted by good service from the guy at the counter and we dined in. Food came out quick and was delicious. Guy who served us even brought extra free fries which was very nice of him. I had a delicious chicken gyro.
...
Overall would recommend. Great experience
Read More

yIROS
•
SKEWERS
•
SALADS
•
SIDES
•
DESSERTS
•take home sauces
• YIROS •
Slow-roasted rotisserie meat sliced and served in a pita or on a plate.
1. CHOOSE IT
IN A PITA   $10.96
Wrapped in a toasted pita with tomatoes and onions.
Add fries IN your pita ($1.59)
ON A PLATE   $16.80
Served with a side of toasted pita, a mini villager salad, and your choice of a side.
Upgrade to Greek Fries extra $1.59
2. FILL IT
CHICKEN  •  PORK BELLY  •  BEEF & LAMB  •  FALAFEL (V)
3. SAUCE IT
TZATZIKI  •  SPICY TZATZIKI  •  SPICY FETA DIP  •  HUMMUS  •  FRESKO SAUCE  •  KETCHUP  •  HOUSE MUSTARD •  LEMON VINAIGRETTE
4. ON A PLATE? SIDE IT.
FRENCH FRIES  •  RICE PILAF  •  DOLMADES
Back To Top
• SKEWERS  •
Tender cuts of grilled meat served with sliced lemon, a side of pita, and sauce.
1. CHOOSE IT
NAKED   $12.08
Served with 2 skewers.
ON A PLATE   $17.14
Served with 2 skewers, a mini villager salad, and a side.
Add an extra skewer to your order ($4.77)
2. STICK IT
CHICKEN  •  PORK
3. SAUCE IT
TZATZIKI  •  SPICY TZATZIKI  •  SPICY FETA DIP  •  HUMMUS  •  FRESKO SAUCE  •  KETCHUP  •  HOUSE MUSTARD •  LEMON VINAIGRETTE
4. ON A PLATE? SIDE IT.
FRENCH FRIES  •  RICE PILAF  •  DOLMADES
BACK TO TOP
• SALADS •
THE VILLAGER    $11.18
Grape tomatoes, cucumber, red onions, red bell peppers, Kalamata olives, feta, and oregano. Served with house-made vinaigrette.
KIPOS SALAD     $9.84
Romaine lettuce, grape tomatoes, red bell peppers, red onions, and cucumbers. Served with white balsamic dressing.
NISI SALAD     $11.18
Shredded kale mix, grape tomatoes, Kalamata olives, onions, and feta. Served with lemon vinaigrette dressing.
add yiro meat ($5.34) • add a skewer ($4.77) • add falafel ($5.90)
BACK TO TOP
• SIDES •
SPANAKOPITA    $7.05
Phyllo pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese.
DOLMADES    $7.05
Grape leaves stuffed with rice and authentic Greek spices.
ZUCCHINI STICKS    $7.05
Breaded, lightly fried, and served with a side of tzatziki.
DIP TRIO    $8.22
Toasted pita with tzatziki, hummus, and spicy feta dip.
PITA AND A DIP    $3.98
Your choice of tzatziki, hummus, or spicy feta dip with toasted pita.
FRENCH FRIES     $5.57
GREEK FRIES    $7.81
Crispy fries with Greek seasoning and feta.
RICE PILAF    $5.06
SIDE OF PITA BREAD    $2.12
FALAFEL    $5.90
5 pieces (V)
SIDE OF Yiro meat    $6.10
choose from chicken, pork belly or beef/lamb
extra SIDE OF sauce    $1.59
BACK TO TOP
• DESSERTS •
HOMEMADE LOUKOUMADES     $6.68
Light pastry puffs served with honey syrup and cinnamon (powdered sugar optional).
Add Nutella ($2.12) Add crushed walnuts ($0.85)
BAKLAVA    $5.57
Layered phyllo pastry with crushed walnuts and syrup.
BACK TO TOP
• TAKE HOME SAUCES •
NOW YOU CAN ENJOY YOUR FAVORITE YIRO YIRO SAUCES AT HOME!
8 OZ. container  $4.00
16 oz. container $7.00
Choose your favorite sauce to take home!  Tzatziki, Spicy Tzatziki, Spicy Feta, Hummus or Fresko!
• BEVERAGES •
Bottled WATER $2.25
LEMONADE $3.00
ICED TEA $3.00
SOFT DRINKS $3.00
BACK TO TOP

we serve you the best
Experience the best at Maq’s Gyro and Grill. Join us in person to savor our delicious, freshly prepared dishes in a warm and inviting atmosphere. Whether it’s a quick bite or a leisurely meal, we promise a memorable dining experience.
At Maq’s, we’re committed to serving up more than just great food – we’re serving a slice of our family’s history with every dish. Each recipe is crafted with care, using only the freshest ingredients and techniques passed down through generations.

Enjoy our special blend of Mediterranean and Latin family recipes. Our catering division partners with you for a special menu.

Pescatarian - Vegetarian - Vegan - Gluten Free Parve - Dairy
We cater the greater Philadelphia community to  schools/colleges, corporate, places of worship, hospitals/medical, shivas, holidays and simchas.

to all the individuals, families, and community leaders who support us and keep
NANA'S KITCHEN
alive! We promise to continue with our dedication and excellent quality adding our love to each dish as we always do.

A cozy and welcoming culinary hideaway, The Tavern serves innovative, seasonal, and fresh American bar fare. The Tavern prides itself in serving classic cocktails and a variety of draughts, as well as a comprehensive selection of wines by the glass and bottle.  Housed in the historic Tavern on Camac, a long-running piano bar and nightclub; it makes a great first or last stop. The restaurant's atmosphere encourages diners to get cozy, relax and enjoy seasonal food and drinks.

Food & Drink Inspired By Philadelphia
Whether it’s a hearty breakfast or a laid-back dinner, our kitchen gives classic plates an unexpected twist while highlighting the finest local ingredients in Philadelphia. At the bar, you’ll find inventive cocktails made with fresh juices, herbs and purees, plus a deep library of whiskeys, gins, and craft brews, and a thoughtfully curated wine list.
Please note: Mimosa Brunch is served Saturday & Sundays only

Menu
Breakfast
10
Scramble Bowl
Tofu scramble topped with veggie chili, avocado and hemp “parm”! Try it with cheez or hot sauce or both!
10
Breakfast Pita
Grilled cheez on pita bread topped with tofu scramble and tomatoes. Try adding avocado or tzatziki!
10
Breakfast Tacos
Corn tortillas topped with tofu scramble, veggie chili, cheez and avocado! (3pc)
10
Avocado Toast
Fresh Avocado slices on toasted buttery ciabatta bread topped with heart healthy hemp seeds, salt and pepper! 4 pieces! Add fresh tomato, coconut bacon or both!
Pitas
12
Buffalo Ranch Chickpea Pita
Buffalo Ranch Chickpea Salad, Shredded Romaine + Tomatoes on Grilled Pita. Try it as a wrap instead or add avocado for an up charge!
13
Falafel Pita
Falafel Patties, Tomatoes, Onions, Cucumbers, our speciality Sriracha Tahini sauce on a grilled pita! Add tzatziki sauce for an up charge!
12
Hummus Pita
Garlic Lemon Hummus, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Onions, Cucumbers on a grilled pita! Add avocado for an up charge or try it on a whole wheat wrap!
13.50
Gyro Pita

13.50

13.50

Vegan Cheez, Smoked Tofu, Pickles, Tomato, Onion, Dijon, Vegan Mayo on a Grilled Panini! One of the best sandwiches you will ever have!
13.50
Avocado BLT Panini
Fresh Sliced Avocado, house-made Coconut Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato and Vegan Mayo on grille panini. Try it with Chk’n or make it a wrap!
11.50
Caprese Panini
Vegan Mozzarella, Tomato, Cashew Pesto on a Grilled Panini. Add Chk’n for an up charge!
Sandwiches
15
Meatball Parm Sub
12 inch roll, meatballs, marinara and cheez whiz.
12.50

Buffalo Chk’n Patty, Lettuce, Pickles, Onions, Tomatoes on Toasted Bun.
11.50

15.50
Cheezsteak
Seitan and cheez whiz served on a 12″ long roll, with your choice of add-ons like spicy cherry pepper spread, fried onions, lettuce, ketchup, mayo or tomato.
15.50
Italian Hoagie
12 inch roll featuring Prime Roots koji salami and ham, vegan smoked provolone, lettuce, tomato, onion, oregano, salt/pepper, oil + vinegar, with an optional cherry pepper spread on the side.

11

11
Hummus Wrap

11
Falafel Wrap

Buffalo Chk’n, Kale, Cucumbers, Onions, Vegan Caesar on a Whole Wheat Wrap! Add avocado for a twist!

13

13

13

13
Falafel Wrap

Greens
14.50
Sesame Crunch Salad
Chopped romaine topped with shredded red cabbage, carrot, cucumber, red onion, smoked tofu, crunchy cashews and crispy stix! Served with our creamy sesame ginger dressing served on the side. Salad is served with toasted pita bread upon request.
14.50
Greek Salad
Chopped romaine, chickpea salad, stuffed grape leaves, kalamata olives, cucumbers, onions, tomatoes, creamy vegan feta and our tahini vinaigrette on the side! Pita bread upon request.
14.50
Avocado BLT Salad
Chopped romaine, sliced avocado, house-made coconut bacon, tomatoes, and our delicious vegan ranch on the side! Pita bread upon request.
14.50
Caesar Salad
Chopped romaine topped with cucumber, onion, house-made pita chip croutons, chk’n and our famous caesar dressing on the side! Pita bread upon request.
14
Build Your Own / Duo
Start with a kale, spinach or romaine base then pick two of your favorite house-made toppings or pair with some plant-based protein like crispy chk’n, smoked tofu or vegan meatballz! Served with grilled pita upon request and your choice of house-made dressing.
15
Build Your Own / Trio
Start with a kale, spinach or romaine base then pick three of your favorite house-made toppings or pair with some plant-based protein like crispy chk’n, smoked tofu or vegan meatballz! Served with grilled pita upon request and your choice of house-made dressing.
Grains
Choice of Brown Rice or Quinoa +$1
Served with your favorite sauce on the side for that perfect drizzle! Add additional protein for $2, choose from: falafel, smoked tofu, chk'n or seitan.
14
Avocado Veggie Bowl

14
Plant Protein Bowl

14
Mediterranean Bowl
Topped with feta, cucumbers, onions, tomatoes, chickpea salad and our famous tzatziki!

Sweet potato fries served with your choice of one dipping sauce (Gold Fever, Ranch, Sweet Dijon or Ketchup). Extra sauces are $1 each.

hello, king of prussia.
we’re ready to treat you to real food & serious flavor.
Location & Hours
Download Menu
Group Dining
Catering Menu
Seasonal Menu
At True Food Kitchen, our menu is carefully crafted so that every bite and every refreshing sip serve up big flavor, an abundance of fresh ingredients and a taste of the unexpected. Our artisan chefs create crave-worthy classics alongside a steady rotation of seasonal offerings that take advantage of naturally ripe fruits and vegetables so their flavor is full and their nutrients, rich. Creative, hand-crafted beverages built around seasonality, quality ingredients and simple preparations complement every occasion from brunch, lunch, dinner and, of course, dessert. Always room for dessert.
Important Information About Our Menu
Menu pricing varies by location – to view location-specific menus, visit our
locations
page.
*These items may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.
Please be aware that our restaurants use gluten and ingredients that contain all the major FDA allergens (peanuts, tree nuts, eggs, fish, shellfish, milk, sesame, soy and wheat).
Our restaurants have shared cooking and preparation areas and the possibility exists for food items to come into contact with other food products. Due to these circumstances, we are unable to guarantee that any menu item can be completely free of allergens. In addition, while effort is made to keep our product information current and as complete as possible, it is possible that ingredient changes and substitutions may occur due to differences in regional suppliers, recipe revisions, preparation techniques, and/or the season of the year.
Before placing your order, please inform your server if someone in your party has a food allergy or a special dietary need and we will do our best to make accommodations.
View our nutritional guide
here
.

raw_text:
WELCOME TO BANH
Home

WELCOME TO BANH
Business hours:
·  MON, TUES, WED, THURS, : 11AM-9PM
·  FRI-SAT: 11AM-9:30PM
·  SUN: 11AM-9PM
Welcome to Banh, where we take pride in serving up authentic Vietnamese cuisine that's bursting with unique flavors and fresh ingredients.
Banh Restaurant offers delicious tasting Vietnamese cuisine in Philadelphia, PA. Banh's convenient location and affordable prices make our restaurant a natural choice for eat-in or take-out meals in the Philadelphia community. Our restaurant is known for its variety in taste and high-quality fresh ingredients. With vegan and gluten-free options available, we're committed to satisfying your taste buds, no matter your dietary restrictions. Come and experience our friendly atmosphere and excellent service.
​
We are an intimate BYOB restaurant.
$5 corkage fee/person
We are on the online ordering flatforms:
DoorDash, Uber Eats, Grubhub & Chinese Menu Online.
Consuming raw or undercooked eggs, meats, poultry, seafood, sellfish or milk products may increase your risk of food borne illness especially if you have certain medical conditions.

About This Location
Devon Yard features five freestanding buildings and six acres situated in the heart of URBN's lifestyle center on the Main Line. As a tribute to the pastoral setting of the nearby Devon Horse Show grounds, the five structures incorporate local materials, such as Pennsylvania field stone and reclaimed barnwood. Inside you'll find our home store filled with nature-inspired décor, candles and lighting, seasonal packaged foods, gifts, and garden gear. Adjacent is our greenhouse with a lush assortment of indoor plants and containers, as well as a station for custom plantings by our Design Services team. Outside, our nursery is filled with locally sourced plants, outdoor containers and gardening essentials, as well as outdoor furniture and fire pits. Learn about our
Store Return Policy
.
Sign Up For Email
Design Services by Terrain
Garden expertise with a creative perspective—for your home, event, and gifting needs. Find arrangements, terrariums, and large-scale custom plantings in our stores or bring our incomparable experience home. From container plantings and flower planning to garden design and patio styling, we offer a range of creative home services. Lastly, let us transform your next special occasion into something truly memorable with our inspired team's unique point-of-view.
Learn More
Store Workshops + Events
From in store maker trunk shows and festival days to virtual cooking demos and gardening Q&As, our seasonal event series’ are full of inspiring, educational, and fun experiences for our fellow gardeners, bakers, makers, and creatives.
Learn More
Terrain Cafe
Our greenhouse cafe offers seasonally changing brunch, lunch, and dinner menus featuring hand-selected local produce, meats, and dairy alongside a thoughtfully curated beverage program from near and far. Served in a deliberately designed environment to blur the line between indoor and outdoor spaces, each cafe's décor is unique, providing an inspiring dining experience every time.
Learn More
Make A Reservation
Terrain Private Events
Terrain Gardens beautifully merges indoor and outdoor spaces to create unexpected color and texture combinations, resulting in a one-of-a-kind beauty. This venue offers four distinctive event spaces that accomodate up to 140 guests. Each venue features a backdrop of lush, ever-changing greenery that will give your wedding a lavish horticultural setting in all seasons.
Learn More
Green Thumb Gifts
Searching for the perfect present for the gardeners in your life? Let them decide with a Terrain Gift Card.

name: Tattooed Mom
raw_text:
Menu - Tattooed Mom
Skip to content
530 South Street  • Philadelphia, PA
More Fun Upstairs
Upstairs @ TMoms
×
20 Years of Street Art Culture
From the first tag to the latest wheat paste, upstairs at TMom’s has been home to a rich history of local & international street art. This is an ever changing gallery: an un-curated & spontaneous outpouring of creativity by local & traveling artists and the countless visitors who leave their unique mark here nightly.
LEARN MORE
Two Brothers & 5000 Umbrellas
The birth of the upstairs as a vibrant art space is in part tied to a 1999 exhibition by brothers Noah & Nathan Rice. That year the Brothers Rice brought their umbrella wheat pastes we’d been admiring around South Street to Mom’s. All 5000 of them.
SEE MORE
Tmoms Sticky Art Machine
Sticker art has been an important part of the upstairs at Mom’s since day one. So it’s a huge honor (and a lot of fun) to be the home of the Sticky Art Machine.
Get Sticky
Back Downstairs

•

About the Business
-Homemade soy milk which goes into all of our delicious smoothies.
-Soy specialty drinks: such as green tea soy steamer, black sesame soy, soy chai, fresh apple-cinnamon soy, soy hot cocoa, and more...
-Homemade vegan salad dressings from whole fruits and veggies: apple-ginger dressing and maple-mustard dressing.
-Gourmet meal-sized salads served with our homemade apple-ginger dressing.
-Organic & Fair Trade coffee, espresso & blended coffee drinks.
-Delicious and hearty sandwiches/wraps made with freshest ingredients, and unique homemade spreads(all vegan) such as sun-dried tomato pesto, soy mayo, wasabi-hummos, spicy hummos, & ginger hummos.  Puts a new spin on traditional sandwich affairs!
-Yummy vegan baked goods all made in house from scratch and gluten-free options.
-Made-to-order soups: mushroom miso, spicy veggie dumpling soup, egg-drop miso, buckwheat noodle soup, udon noodle soup, & seafood ramen soup.
…

A:
We try to use as much organic and local as possible, when possible. 
Always serving organic coffee & organic soy milk.

A tantalizing fusion
of Chinese and Asian
kissed by French.
Whether you’re in the mood for your favorite Chinese or a pan-Asian culinary adventure, CinCin’s gracious servers can recommend delightful dishes, perfectly-paired wines, fine teas and positively Cin-ful desserts.
Lunch
Mon-Sat  11:30 – 3:00
Dinner
Mon-Thu    3:00 – 9:30
Fri-Sat         3:00 – 10:30
Sunday      Noon – 9:30
EVENTS
Monday thru Thursday, our chefs and servers love to seriously pamper up to 35 dinner guests in the polished wood and brass of our private dining room.
And in the daytime, both sunny dining rooms come alive when we host up to 100 guests for a luncheon or special event.
From business casual to party-perfect, our event planner will help make your gathering successful and delightful. Just call
215-242-8800
.

Made From Scratch, Every Day
Founding Farmers Menus
We are dedicated to serving high-quality, real food with an emphasis on cooking from scratch. We bake our own bread, grind our own beef in-house, churn our own ice cream, and distill our own booze.

Our Inspiration
America’s Rich Culinary Tradition
Our menus are inspired by our country’s rich culinary tradition, including our versions of all-American classics, as well as innovative creations based on a wide range of American cuisine.
Our Founding Farmers breakfast, brunch, lunch & dinner, dessert, and drinks menus are inspired by our nation’s rich culinary traditions and includes our takes on all-American favorites, like Chicken & Waffles, hand-formed burgers with freshly cut fries, and apple pie.
Simply put, our Founding Farmers menus are filled with delicious, scratch-made food and drink, served with exceptional hospitality, all while working to preserve our planet.

About the Business
Harvest Seasonal Grill features a local, farm to table menu with many items that are below 500 calories in an upscale casual atmosphere. Every three months, we update our menu to celebrate the new flavors that accompany the change in seasons. We also offer 50+ wines by the glass, as well as a growing selection of local and organic beers.

At Harvest, we believe that where your food comes from is as important as what you eat, which is why we champion the ideology of 'know your farmer, know your food'. We work with over 75 local farmers to source the freshest and highest quality products available. Our mission of sustainability and green living is carried through every facet of what we do, from our menu to our decor, and even the cleaning products that we use are eco-friendly.

name: All The Way Live
raw_text:
Menu | All The Way Live Cafe
Home
Menu
Blogs

Contact
Home
Menu
Blogs
About Us
Contact
Menu
Small (Choice of 3) $15
Medium (Choice of 4) $20
Large (Choice of 5) $25
Pita Pocket (Choice of 2) $15
Pita Pocket (Choice of 3) $17
Coconut Wrap (Choice of 2) $17
Coconut Wrap (Choice of 3) $19
Side (Choice of 1) $7
Live Cuisine
Marinated Cabbage
Crisp green cabbage, gently marinated in a blend of savory herbs and spices. This refreshing dish offers a bright, tangy bite with earthy undertones—simple, clean, and packed with flavor.
Sea Green Salad
Delicate wakame seaweed tossed with fresh herbs and a drizzle of toasted sesame oil. This mineral-rich salad is light, silky, and deeply satisfying—a taste of the ocean with every bite.
Kale Salad
Fresh kale massaged with cold-pressed olive oil and brightened with lime juice and herbs. Bold, zesty, and nutrient-dense—this simple salad is a crisp celebration of greens done right.
Hummus
A creamy blend of sprouted chickpeas, whipped raw for maximum vitality and flavor. Smooth, earthy, and enzyme-rich—this living hummus is a clean twist on a timeless classic.
Wild Rice
Sprouted wild rice tossed with kale, sweet bell peppers, onions, and fresh herbs. This hearty, raw-prepared dish is bursting with texture, color, and deep earthy flavor—a nourishing bowl that satisfies and energizes.
"No Meat" Nutmeat
A savory mix of walnuts, onions, and herbs, blended to perfection. Rich in flavor and texture, this plant-powered classic brings a satisfying bite to any plate—simple, bold, and endlessly versatile.
BBQ Mushrooms
Meaty portabella mushrooms marinated in a smoky, tangy blend of herbs and spices. Bold and juicy with deep umami flavor, this raw BBQ favorite delivers serious satisfaction—no flame needed.
Corn Salad
Sweet corn tossed with crisp mixed veggies, fresh herbs, and a vibrant blend of spices. Light, colorful, and full of crunch—this raw salad is sunshine in every bite.
Squash "Tuna"
Butternut squash blended with our house-made herb almond mayo, sea greens, and a savory mix of spices. Smooth, flavorful, and deeply satisfying—this plant-based twist on tuna is raw comfort food at its finest.
Avocado
Creamy, buttery, and rich in flavor, our avocado is served at peak ripeness to bring out its natural smooth texture and subtle nutty notes.
Cooked Cuisine
Quinoa Salad
Known as the “mother grain,” quinoa is paired with a vibrant medley of fresh vegetables and herbs. Light, nourishing, and full of texture—this salad brings balance to every bite.
Forbidden Black Rice
An ancient grain once reserved for royalty—black rice meets kale, vibrant vegetables, fresh herbs, and grounding burdock root. Deeply nourishing and full of flavor, this dish is as bold as it is healing.
Sabgi
Mixed vegetables slow-cooked in mild Indian spices. Fragrant, nourishing, and full of gentle warmth—this dish is comfort in every spoonful.
Chickpea Chili
Hearty chickpeas simmered in a bold, savory blend of spices, herbs, and slow-cooked vegetables. Rich in flavor and warmth—this chili is comfort food with a plant-based twist.
Candied Calabaza Squash
Steamed calabaza squash gently simmered with cinnamon, cortex, and rich black agave. Sweet, spiced, and silky—this comforting dish melts on the tongue like sunshine in every bite.
Black Chickpeas
Earthy heirloom black chickpeas slow-cooked with savory herbs and warming spices. Deeply satisfying and rich in tradition—this dish delivers bold flavor in every bite.
Steamed Broccoli
Fresh, tender broccoli florets gently steamed to preserve their vibrant green color, natural sweetness, and delicate crunch.
Live Lasagna
Delicious layers of fresh vegetables, herbs, and creamy house-made nut cheese, stacked between thinly sliced zucchini “pasta.” A raw, flavor-packed twist on a classic—light, luscious, and entirely plant-powered.
Single $20
w/ 1 side $25
w/ 2 sides $30
Add Avocado +$5
Add Broccoli +$5
Cooked Spaghetti
An irresistible homemade tomato sauce, slow-simmered with a hearty mix of mushrooms and vegetables. Served over your choice of spelt or black rice noodles, with
steamed broccoli
or a
fresh side salad
. Classic comfort—made clean and plant-based.
Regular $18
Deluxe $26
Live burgers
Chickpea Burger
A sprouted chickpea and vegetable patty layered with crisp lettuce, juicy tomatoes, and onions, finished with our house-made herb nut mayo. Clean, hearty, and full of plant-powered goodness—this burger hits every note.
$15
Chickpea Mushroom Burger
A savory blend of sprouted chickpeas and mushrooms, crafted into a satisfying patty and topped with crisp lettuce, tomato, onion, and a creamy herb nut mayo. Bold, balanced, and full of umami—this burger brings depth to every bite.
$17
Nut Burger
A sprouted chickpea and vegetable patty layered with crisp lettuce, juicy tomatoes, and onions, finished with our house-made herb nut mayo. Clean, hearty, and full of plant-powered goodness—this burger hits every note.
$15
Add Avocado to your Burger +$5
Cooked burgers
Jackfruit Burger
Tender, seasoned jackfruit grilled to perfection and topped with sautéed bell peppers, onions, and our signature house barbecue sauce. Finished with a slather of creamy almond mayo—bold, juicy, and stacked with flavor.
$16
Mushroom Pepper "Cheese Steak"
A savory medley of mushrooms, bell peppers, and onions sizzled to perfection and layered onto a warm spelt flatbread. Topped with our luscious house-made almond cream cheese—rich, satisfying, and dripping with flavor in every bite.
$16
Add Avocado to your Burger +$5
Chickpea “Tuna” Salad
A wholesome twist on a classic favorite. Protein-rich chickpeas are mashed and blended with crisp vegetables, fresh herbs, and our house seasoning to create a creamy, savory salad that delivers comfort and nourishment in every bite—without the fish.
$15
Salads
House Salad
A vibrant mix of spring greens, summer squash, juicy tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, peppers, and onions—tossed with our signature house-made dressing. Fresh, colorful, and bursting with garden-grown flavor.
$15
Avocado Spinach Salad
Tender spinach leaves tossed with creamy avocado, summer squash, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and onions—all brought together with our famous house dressing. Rich, refreshing, and full of vibrant, nourishing flavor.
$18
Side Salad
A small house salad
$7
Soups
Chickpea Chili
Hearty chickpeas simmered in a bold, savory blend of spices, herbs, and slow-cooked vegetables. Rich in flavor and warmth—this chili is comfort food with a plant-based twist.
Small $7                              Large $11
Squash Soup
Creamy roasted butternut squash blended with aromatic spices for a soul-soothing bowl of comfort. Silky, spiced, and naturally sweet—this soup wraps you in warmth with every spoonful.
Small $7                              Large $11
Sabgi
Mixed vegetables slow-cooked in mild Indian spices. Fragrant, nourishing, and full of gentle warmth—this dish is comfort in every spoonful.
Small $8                              Large $12
Black Chickpeas
Earthy heirloom black chickpeas slow-cooked with savory herbs and warming spices. Deeply satisfying and rich in tradition—this dish delivers bold flavor in every bite.
Small $9                              Large $12
Heirloom Purple Majestic Potato Line
Belizean Style Potato Salad
A vibrant twist on a classic—made with Purple Majesty potatoes, house-made mayonnaise, and our signature relish. Tossed with crisp string beans, garden peas, and non-GMO corn for a colorful, hearty, and deeply satisfying
Regular $10                              Deluxe $20
Air Fries
Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside—these guilt-free fries are made from vibrant Purple Majesty potatoes and lightly seasoned to perfection. A colorful, antioxidant-rich take on a classic comfort food.
$8
Mashed Potatoes
Creamy, vibrant, and full of flavor—these mashed Purple Majesty potatoes are whipped to perfection for a naturally colorful and nutrient-rich side. Comfort food with a royal twist.
$7
Live delicious Desserts
Apple Cake
Two lush layers of spiced apple perfection—crafted from fresh, raw ingredients and naturally sweetened. This cake is soft, satisfying, and topped with our dreamy house-made vanilla icing. It’s dessert, redefined—pure, plant-based pleasure in every bite.
$12
Carob Cake
Two decadent layers of rich, smooth carob cake sweetened with agave and crafted from pure, whole ingredients. Finished with a creamy, dreamy carob icing that melts into every bite. A soulful, chocolate-adjacent indulgence—without the cacao.
$12
Cheesecake
Our signature cheesecake is rich, silky, and refreshingly light—made with young coconut meat and the finest plant-based ingredients. A decadent dessert with a clean finish, beloved for its pure flavor and creamy texture.
$12
Apple Pie
Thinly sliced Fuji apples tossed with sweet medjool dates and warm spices, nestled in a buttery almond crust. Fresh, vibrant, and full of flavor—this raw twist on a classic brings comfort and crunch in every bite.
$10
Banana Cream Pie
A silky young coconut cream layered over fresh banana slices, all nestled in a tender almond crust. Light, luscious, and naturally sweet—this dreamy pie is a tropical take on a timeless favorite.
$12
Berry Cream Pie
Lush young coconut cream swirled with seasonal berries, set in a delicate almond crust. Bright, smooth, and bursting with fresh flavor—this raw dessert is a perfect balance of creamy and tart.
$12
Vanilla Ice Cream
Our in-house ice cream is churned from creamy coconut milk, sweetened with raw agave, and infused with fresh vanilla beans. Smooth, rich, and refreshingly pure—this is vanilla ice cream done the live way.
$5
w/ Fruit Toppings +$2
Carob Ice Cream
House-made and ultra creamy, our carob ice cream is crafted with coconut milk, raw agave, and fresh vanilla. A smooth, chocolate-adjacent treat that’s rich, refreshing, and completely plant-based.
$6
w/ Fruit Toppings +$2
Apple Glow-Up Pie
A wholesome take on the classic. Think warm cinnamon apples, gooey agave drizzle, and a golden spelt crust. It’s the comfort you crave with ingredients your body loves.
$12
Dreamy Squash Pie
A luscious, nutrient-rich twist on a Southern classic. Creamy squash meets cinnamon and nutmeg in a golden spelt crust, velvety smooth, and sweet,. Your body and taste buds will thank you.
$12

A Neighborhood Staple
Sabrina’s Cafe opened its newest location on South Street in the vibrant Graduate Hospital area in 2022, bringing an exciting new twist to the Philadelphia brunch scene. This location features our first full-service bar, offering handcrafted drinks to complement our beloved brunch dishes. With sidewalk seating and a wheelchair-accessible space, we welcome everyone to enjoy a warm and inviting atmosphere.
For those wanting to find excellent breakfast, lunch or brunch in Philly, our South Street cafe is the perfect stop before exploring nearby activities like the Philadelphia Magic Gardens, the galleries of South Street, and the scenic Schuylkill River Park. Located just minutes from Rittenhouse Square, our cafe is a convenient spot for both work breaks and leisurely weekend outings.
Situated near major hospitals like Pennsylvania Hospital and Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia, Sabrina’s has become a go-to for healthcare workers looking for a comforting meal after a long shift.
Our South Street location boasts natural light, captivating art, and vibrant decor, creating a lively and stylish brunch destination. More than just a cafe, Sabrina’s is a vibrant part of the Graduate Hospital community, where the best brunch Philadelphia has to offer meets great company in a space that feels like home.

Menu
Injera (ethiopian Bread):
Injera is a staple of traditional Ethiopian cuisine. It is usually made with flour ground from the seeds of teff, a grain that was domesticated as many as 6,000 years ago in
Ethiopia
,
and that is the smallest known grain in the world.
Teff is high in Fiber, Proten, Iron, Calcium, Vitamin B1, and Mineral content. Injera can also be made using
barley
,
millet
, or
wheat
flour. We also offer 100% glueten free Injera for additional charge.
Starters
Almaz house salad:
Tomato, red Onions, Cucumber, hard-boiled egg, and Romaine lettuce with a side of red wine vinaigrette
Ceaser Salad:
Hearts of roamin lettuce, grated parmesan cheese and croutons toss with ceaser dressing.
Fresh Berry salad:
Romaine lettuce, Strawberries, Tomatoes, chopped Pecans or Walnuts served side of balsamic vingegar.
Ethiopian Salad:
Romaine lettuce, tomato, red onion, jalapeno pepper and olive oil.
Greek Salad:
Romaine Lettuce, black olives, sliced red onion, cucumbers, Fata cheese served with side of honey balsamic vinger dressing.
Ethiopian Dishes:
FIRFIR
Enjera moistened with deliciously tender cubed beef simmered to perfection in organic Ethiopian butter, berbere sauce with garlic and authentic Ethiopian spices.
DORO WOT:
Chicken stew. Tender chicken leg and thigh marinated in lemon sauteed in seasoned butter and stewed in red pepper sauce, flavored with onions, garlic, ginger root and pinch of cardamon. Served with side sour cream.
DORO TIBS:
Strips of checken breast sauteed with onions, jalapeno pepper, rosemary, exotic herbs, organic Ethiopian butter topped with doro sauce.
Zilzile Tibs
Strips of tender beef sauteed with onions, jalapeno pepper, rosemary, exotic herbs, organic Ethiopian butter, served with awaze sauce.
SEGA ALECHA
Beef alecha. Tender of cubes beef marinated with ethipian butter sauteed with onion, tomato, fresh garlic and mild curry..
KEYEWOT
Tender beef marinated cooked with tomato, red onion, garlic, barber sauce, ginger root and pinch of cardamon. Served with side of sour cream
GORED GORED
Tender cube of beef dipped in Ethiopian butter and awaze sauce (spice sauce).
KITFO:
Ethiopian steak tartar. Lean tender chopped prime beef seasoned with Ethiopian butter and mitmita (powdered chili pepper and red pepper.).
Yebege Tibs:
Tender cubs of boneless leg of lamb sauteed with onion, tomato, jalapeno pepper, rosemary, herbed with purified organic Ethiopian butter served with side of red lentil and cabbage stew.
Yebege Alecha:
Tender cubes of boneless leg of lab marinated with Ethiopian butter and Almaz special seasoning sauteed with onion, tomato, garlic and mild curry.
CHICKEN CURRY:
Strips of chicken breast cooked with onion red and green peppers, tomato, garlic, curry powder, pinch of cinnamon, served over rice and side cabbage stew.
BEEF CURRY:
Tender beef marinated with tomato, red onion, garlic, barber sauce, ginger root, curry powder and pinch of cardamom. Served over rice with side of cabbage.
BEEF CURRY:
Tender beef marinated with tomato, red onion, garlic, barber sauce, ginger root, curry powder and pinch of cardamom. Served over rice with side of cabbage.
ETHIOPIAN VEGETRIAN DISHES
Our Vegeterian dishes are nutrient-dense meal that keeps you full for hours. Packed with Protein, Fiber, Omega 3. Vitamins & Minearls. Free Of Preservatives. No Artificial Flavors. 100% Vegan, and 100% gluten Free bread for addational charge.
MISIR:
Split red lentils cooked in berbere sauce and fine herbs blended with chopped onions.
ALICHA  MISIR:
Whole lentils cooked with turmeric, onions, green peppers and spiced with various Almaz spice for perfection.
TIKELGOMEN:
Lightly spiced vegetable stew of cabbage, carrots and potatoes.
KIKALECHA:
Yellow split peas flavored with turmeric, green peppers and various spices.
SHIRO:
Chickpeas powder cooked in berbere sauce and fine herbs blended with chopped onions.
FOULE:
Faba beans smashed, and spiced, garnished with fresh diced tomatoes, green pepper and onions.
Faba beans are highly nutritious because of their high protein content: they are a good source of mineral nutrients, vitamins,
KEYESIR:
Red Beets cooked with potatoes, onion, garlic, oil and seasoned with almaz special seasoning for perfection.
VEGETARIAN COMBINATION:
COMBINATION OF ALL VEGETARIAN DISHES
Dessert
Our desserta are provided by local well know pastery shop
TRIPLE LAYERS CHOCOLATE CAKE
All fresh Fruites Smoothies
BAKLAVA:
BASSETTS ICECREAM
almaz cafe is family owned restaurant stableshed in 2007 proudely serving ethiopian dishes and more

Our Food
Our mission is to deliver the brightest, freshest and most flavorful food at a reasonable price.
All of our food is prepared daily.
Nothing is ever prepackaged, canned or frozen.
We trim, marinate and prepare all of our meat on premise.
Guacamole and salsas are prepared several times a day.
We use small independent purveyors whenever possible.
We value your business and your thoughts.

Shot’is P’uri \
შოტის პური
\: Fresh Baked Bread
Oversized tonè style (Georgian tandoor) sourdough bread, baked fresh daily. Traditionally canoe shaped & lovingly kneaded from Lucile, our mother dough.
Supra Bites\
სუფრა
\: Feast
Small plates traditionally served as accoutrements during the famed Georgian Supra (celebratory feast).

supra bites \
სუფრა
\: feast
Small plates traditionally served during a Georgian feast
Pkhali Trio
Roasted beetroot, eggplant & spinach in a toasted walnut, allium & khmeli suneli dry spice. Pomegranate molasses & Adjika hot honey drizzle.
Eggplant Trio
Roasted eggplant stuffed with beetroot, spinach & eggplant phkali on a bed of garlic labneh. Pomegranate garnish.
Adjapsandali
Georgian ratatouille of slow roasted eggplant, bell peppers, tomato, alliums, khmeli suneli.
Lobio
Red kidney bean mash in aromatic khmeli suneli dry spice, feta, cilantro, topped with pomegranate.
Kartuli Salati
Chopped salad of diced tomato, onion, cucumber and bell peppers with traditional sunflower oil and garlic walnut bahze dressing.
Kharcho Soup
Traditional beef stew in tomato broth with rice, spiced with kharcho suneli dry spices and fresh herb.
Penovani
Buttery, crispy, flakey puff pastry stuffed with suluguni cheese, feta & ricotta. Think savory croissant stuffed with Khachapuri cheese.
Penovani By the Dozen
Carry-out Penovani Box. Get a trio, half-dozen or one-dozen. Mix-&-Match with our current Penovani special.
limonadi \
ლიმონათი
\: beverages
Fun traditional Georgian soda pops, natural mineral water, and all natural fruit compotes.
Limonadi \
ლიმონათ
\: Sodas & Beverages
Fun traditional Georgian soda pops (in Georgia all sodas are called Limonadi), natural mineral water, and all natural fruit compotes. (Flavors & brands may vary per stock availability. Order online for the latest options.)

Soup Dumplings
Classic 50/50 beef & pork mix, buillon, khmeli suneli dry spice, cilantro, parsley.
Mushroom Spinach
Seasonal mushroom medley, bouillon, and khemli suneli dry spice.
Ostri Oxtail
Oxtail slow braised in Ostri, a traditional Georgian spiced beef and tomato stew.
Traditional
Traditional open-faced khachapuri known as the iconic "cheeseboat." RECOMMENDED: Side of Adjika Sunflower Oil.
Borodinsky
Soviet black bread with caraway and coriander. Side of whole grain mustard and gherkin. RECOMMENDED: Side of Gypsy Bacon.
Mushroom
Seasonal mushroom medley roasted in adjika & khemli suneli mix. RECOMMENDED: Side of Beet Horseradish.
Honey Brie
House-made Adjika hot honey, brie, toasted walnuts. RECOMMENDED: Side of orange blossom honeycomb when available.
Red Shakshuka
Red Adjika & tomato: Intense traditional hot pepper paste, fresh garlic, coriander, dill.
Rotating Specials
Ask about our current specials in-store or keep track online. Certain specials become available via online/mobile ordering only.
Recent Specials Include
House-made Kalbasa Adjaraluli & Kartuli Lamb Sausage Adjaruli with roasted thyme, fennel, asparagus, grilled lemon.
Recent Specials Include
Slow-braised pulled pork with a house- made tangy tkhemali plum BBQ sauce with an Ex-Soviet style carrot-cabbage slaw.

Khach’ap’uri Adjaruli\
ხაჭაპური
\: Cheeseboats
Hand kneaded from Lucile, our mother dough, each sourdough boat is stuffed with our mix of shredded Bulgarian feta and suluguni cheese. Once out of the oven the molten cheese is topped with a pad of butter & egg yolk.

Award-Winning Philadelphia Cuisine
About
Menus
Private Dining
Offers
Gift certificates
Menu
Fine Dining, Redefined
For over two decades, Lacroix has been a pillar of Philadelphia's fine dining scene, where technique, creativity, and hospitality come together above historic Rittenhouse Square. Now, we're embracing a new era. One that keeps the spirit of fine dining but loosens the tie. Expect recognizable dishes with a fresh perspective, an atmosphere that puts you at ease, and a team that knows how to make any night feel like the right one to be out. Whether you're celebrating or just making the most of a random Tuesday, we're here to make it special - no occasion required.
Make A Reservation
legacy meets modern flavor
Decadent yet approachable, Lacroix invites you to relax and indulge in the finer things. Our menu is a love letter to the French bistro: familiar flavors, layered with technique, and always evolving with the season. Think buttery omelettes crowned with a vin jaune sabayon, house-made Parisian gnocchi with mushroom glace, or a rich, melt-in-your-mouth bone marrow burger. Our raw bar, seasonal vegetables, and shareable small plates make every meal feel both refined and effortlessly enjoyable.
View our Menus
Cocktails Rooted in Nature & Story
Created with James Beard Award-winning mixologist Danny Childs, our cocktail program is all about bold flavors and fresh twists. Think local botanicals, foraged ingredients, and a dash of Philly's history in every glass. Whether it's a reimagined Martini or our take on the historic tipple Fish House Punch, each drink brings something unexpected. We're here to surprise you with every sip, keeping things fresh, local, and always intriguing.
View Menu
Lunch at Lacroix
Whether business or pleasure, Lacroix’s three-course prix fixe lunch offers a delicious midday escape from Monday through Saturday.
Our Menus
